text.__SUMMARY__: Common names: Baran's adder, Turkish viper.Vipera barani is a venomous viper species endemic to Turkey. No subspecies are currently recognized.
text.Etymology: The specific name, barani, is in honor of Turkish herpetologist İbrahim Baran.
text.Description: V. barani is a stoutly built species. Adult females are reported to reach a maximum total length (body + tail) of 60 cm (24 in). Adult males are shorter with a maximum total length of 54.5 cm (21.5 in).
text.Geographic range:
V. barani is found in northwestern Turkey.
The type locality is listed as "ca. 60 km N Adapazari, Türkei" (= Adapazari, Turkey).
text.Conservation status: The species V. barani is listed as strictly protected (Appendix II) under the Berne Convention.

text.Further reading: Böhme W, Joger U (1984). "Eine neue Art des Vipera berus-Komplexes aus der Türkei ". Amphibia-Reptilia 4 [1983] (2-4): 265-271. (Vipera barani, new species). (in German).
